body_html:
In theory, you should just be able to set the following environment variables before building to get Python 3:

export TF_BUILD_CONTAINER_TYPE=CPU
export TF_BUILD_PYTHON_VERSION=PYTHON3
export TF_BUILD_IS_OPT=OPT
export TF_BUILD_IS_PIP=PIP
export USER="${USER:-jenkins}"
tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_build.sh PI tensorflow/tools/ci_build/pi/build_raspberry_pi.sh

I haven't tried this myself though, so it may well be trickier than that.

The scripts will be part of the 1.4 release, along with some official 1.4 Pi binaries, but they're also available in the nightlies.

body:
In theory, you should just be able to set the following environment variables before building to get Python 3:
```
export TF_BUILD_CONTAINER_TYPE=CPU
export TF_BUILD_PYTHON_VERSION=PYTHON3
export TF_BUILD_IS_OPT=OPT
export TF_BUILD_IS_PIP=PIP
export USER="${USER:-jenkins}"
tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_build.sh PI tensorflow/tools/ci_build/pi/build_raspberry_pi.sh
```
I haven't tried this myself though, so it may well be trickier than that.

The scripts will be part of the 1.4 release, along with some official 1.4 Pi binaries, but they're also available in the nightlies.
